response.answer_text: Yes, both Greece and the former middle East used to be very intelligent before religion. Matter of fact, the word ALGEBRA is an Arabic word and many stars have an Arabic name. The middle Eastern and Greek people were very intelligent with math and astronomy but during sometime in history, education was viewed as bad and higher intelligence was destroyed, and scientists captured and killed in the name of religion or from invasion and war. Going back to your question, there ARE ancient technologies. One is called the ”Baghdad Battery” which actually did store energy and was the world's first battery:     And here we have the world's FIRST computer. It was found in the sea but actually was robbed and fell off a ship. It was originally created in Greece and the point of it was to calculate the days and months as well as seasons. It is called the Antikythera mechanism. The Antikythera mechanism is an ancient Greek analogue computer used to predict astronomical positions and eclipses for calendar and astrological purposes decades in advance. It could also be used to track the four-year cycle of athletic games.   There are MANY more ancient technologies out there, many probably lost forever due to attempts from religious groups or extremists destroying these ancient relics or theives stealing them to sell on the black market.
